reviews.text: Located close to town but a stair climb and uphill walk required to reach the city center. Beautiful facility with high-class amenities including slippers, linen rugs bedside. Tasteful lobby area. Garage parking available but expensive; street parking possible. Hotel breakfast also expensive, but some weekday neighborhood options available. Interesting wine bar just down he street. Helpful staff.
reviews.title: Well worth considering
very pleasant
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, we stayed here for 2 nights in Aug with our son. The room was like a first class american hotel. We found it pleasant, very quiet but a bit off the path for walking to the main area. Maybe 10 to 15 minutes but it was hot then. If you went in cooler months you would not mind the walk. The hotel it self was very hard to find. There were signs posted for all the other hotels except this one and we drove past it a few times as its location is not what you'd expect and the sign on the building is very small.

The last review on Hotel Rector on tripadvisor doesn't sound like the Hotel Rector. There is no garden and no suites with balconies as far as I have seen. Neither is there a restaurant. They do have a breakfastroom where they serve a nice breakfast for 10 euros p.p.

reviews.text: At the reception they all spoke English, however they don't in Salamanca!
The room we had was downstairs and walled-in. So no view whatsoever, which was a bit disappointing and a bit dark, but quiet.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Salamanca
First rate
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is first rate: staff, spacious rooms, gorgeous all-marble bathroom, slippers, robes, and AC. The staff could not have been more accomodating. The duty person came down to the parking lot and helped us unload our car and put baggage in the elevator. There were many comfortable public areas to sit and chat and the free public computer was very fast and new. The Rector is expensive but definitely was worth it. It is a 10 minute walk to the Plaza Mayor and the university. The Art Nouveau/Deco museum is definitely worth a visit.
My only criticism is that the room carpeting was stained and needed either replacement or cleanng. I'd go with hard wood floors if it were my call.

reviews.text: We slept in most mornings and did not have the breakfast. But they recommended several excellent restaurants. Our favorites were Blue Azul (vegetarian, healthy, fresh), Chez Victor (giant almond cookie at end of meal) and El Pecado (chocolate dessert and garlic soup to die for).

reviews.title: charming and relaxing stay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Rector for 5 nights in April 2005. The hotel is located near most of the historic sites and only a 10 minute walk from the Plaza Mayor. We booked a standard room for 2 people and we had a lovely room across from the New Cathedral. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable and clean. The marble bathroom was spectacular. The hotel is very charming with hardwood floors in the reception area. It is very clean also....even the carpets and bedspreads. It is a small hotel and quiet. You feel like you're the only one there. The owners/hosts were very pleasant. Our room was refreshed after our afternoon siesta everday. The only drawback was that not everyone spoke English at the front desk. They did their best to try and understand and help however and would try to find someone that did speak English to help. Also, as a small hotel, there weren't any organized tours or excusions. Salamanca is a beautiful, clean city, with much to see and enjoy at a relaxed pace. Hotel Rector is a wonderful place to stay to enjoy the city. We would definitely stay again.
